__e: Look, Mitchell, I don't want any trouble.
Mr. Mitchell, I came here because your son asked me to.
Col. Mitchell, at this time, I remind you that under the Articles of War, you have three choices as to procedure.
Mitchell is out there asking questions is he?
I think you've some idea what's in the papers... when the former Attorney General comes to the office... when it's taking place at the Committee to Re-Elect... and got a raincoat over his head.
...and old Charlie Mitchell went into the café and the girl is sitting on his knee!
Lieutenant, I trust you realize that Miss Mitchell is a rather influential lady.
Say, I see you made Mitchell's column this morning.
Mitchell's talking about... putting another team on the case.
Miss Mitchell and I have a lot to talk over.
You talk about the war, Mitchell and the rest, but you didn't know them!
It's not too important. Mitchell and Son, that's what matters.
Well, as Miss Mitchell said, the body was found in her safe in her house.
